snippet: Supporters of the plan for a bike racing track  in Brooklyn Bridge Park said the neighborhood was too costly, and Joshua P. Rechnitz, who pledged $50 million, said he would seek another location.
abstract: Philanthropist Joshua P Rechnitz abandons plans to bring bicycle racing track to Brooklyn Bridge Park; supporters of the velodrome say neighborhood is just too costly.
lead_paragraph: Supporters of the plan for a bike racing track  in Brooklyn Bridge Park said the neighborhood was too costly, and Joshua P. Rechnitz, who pledged $50 million, said he would seek another location.

headline.seo: Joshua P. Rechnitz Abandons Plan for Velodrome in Brooklyn Bridge Park
headline.main: Philanthropist Abandons Plan for Velodrome in Brooklyn Park
headline.print_headline: Philanthropist Abandons Plan For Velodrome in Brooklyn Park
